page.title: 12TREWITHEN HOUSE AND GARDENS
page.content: {Trewithen House and Gardens.} Trewithen means in Cornish "house in the spinney".Nowadays the house ocasionally,& the gardens frequently, are open to the public with average attendances of 25,000 a year. The present owners are descended from the Hawkins family,who were largely responsible for building the Georgian house.Many important people have been entertained here,including this year the Queen Mother.The gardens cover about 28 acres,& were mainly established this century.They are par_ ticularly famous for their exotic spring flowers:magnolias & camellias,& several hybrid species have been developed in the nurseries eg.a rhod_ odendron "Trewithen Orange".The nurseries export plants to the USA & elsewhere.Employees have recently increased,4 in house,6 in gardens.
